bibl.title: Memorandum from A.S. Dabney to Jefferson Randolph Kean, April 15, 1938

div1.p: Dabney provides Kean with a chronological listing of Reed's service in the U.S. Army Medical Corps.

div1.head: Memorandum from A.S. Dabney to Jefferson Randolph Kean, April 15, 1938
div1.p:
MEMORANDUM FOR General Kean.
Subject: Information re Service of Dr. Walter Reed.

list.item:
Dr. Walter Reed was appointed Asst. Surgeon, U. S. Army on June
26, 1875. He accepted appointment on July 3, 1875. From July 3, 1875
to July 23, 1875, he was at Murfreesboro, N. C., awaiting orders.
July 23, 1875, to April 14, 1876, on duty at Willets Point, N. Y.

April 15, 1876, to May 21, 1876, enroute to Dept. of California
with recruits from New York City.
June 1, 1876, to August 5, 1876, on duty at Fort Yuma, California.
August 5, 1876, to August 10, 1877, on duty at Camp Lowell, Ariz.
August 10, 1877, to May 10, 1880, on duty at Camp Apache, Ariz.

May 10, 1880, to June 8, 1880, enroute to and awaiting orders at
Richmond, Virginia.
June 26, 1880, promoted Asst. Surgeon with rank of Captain.

June 9, 1880, to September 3, 1880, on leave of absence and await-
ing orders.

Sept. 6, 1880, to Sept. 18, 1880, on duty with Rifel Team at
Creedmoor, L. I.
Sept. 23, 1880, to Feb. 23, 1881, on duty at Fort Ontario, N. Y.
Feb. 24, 1881, to May 2, 1881, on duty at Fort McHenry, Ma.
May 2, 1881, to Nov. 17, 1882, on duty at Washington Barracks, D. C.

March, 1882, examined for promotion at New York City and found
qualified.

Nov. 17, 1882, to Dec. 4, 1882, enroute to and at Headquarters
Dept. of the Platte for orders.

Dec. 4, 1882, to Jan. 1, 1883, Attending Surgeon at Headquarters
Dept. of the Platte, Omaha, Nebr.
Jan. 2, 1883, to Oct, 4, 1883, on duty at Fort Omaha, Nebr.
Oct. 5, 1883, to Aug, 4, 1884, on duty at Fort Sidney, Nebr.
Aug, 8, 1884, to July 31, 1887, on duty at Fort Robinson, Nebr.
Aug. 5, 1887, to Oct. 6, 1890, on duty at Mt. Vernon Bks,, Ala.

Oct. 6, 1890, to Oct. 31, 1891, on duty as Attending Surgeon and
Examiner of Recruits at Baltimore, Maryland.
Nov. 7, 1891, to Aug. 21, 1892, on duty at Fort Snelling, Minn.

Aug. 21, 1592 to Aug. 31, 1893, Attending Surgeon and Examiner
of Recruits at St. Paul, Minn.
Sept. 6, 1893, Curator of the Army Medical Museum.

Sept., 1893, examined at Washington, D. C., for promotion and found
qualified.
Sept. 11, 1893, to Oct. 21, 1893, member of Army Medical Board.
Promoted Surgeon with the rank of Major on Dec. 4, 1893.

July 22, 1896, to August 7, 1896, on detached service Key West,
Florida.
Member Cholera Band Board.

Aug. 1, 1898, to Aug. 8, 1898, on detached duty making an inspec-
tion of Camps and Field Hospitals.

Aug. 20, 1898, to Sept. 18, 189, member of typhoid fever board
and inspecting certain camps.

Sept. 25, 1898, to Sept. 30, 1898, member of board investigating
causes of typhoid fever.
Oct. 1, 1898, to Oct. 10, 1898, on duty with typhoid fever board.

Oct. 18, 1898, to Oct. 25, 1898, on detached service inspecting
buildings at Natural Bridge, Virginia.

Apr. 19, 1899, to May 9, 1899, on inspection duty at Puerto
Principe, Cuba.

Sept. 28, 1899, to Sept. 30, 1899, on detached duty at Fort Thomas,
Kentucky.

Oct. 31, 1899, to Nov. 3, 1899, delegate to American Public Health
Association, Minneapolis, Minnesota.

March 7, 1900, to Apr. 3, 1900, on duty at Tampa, Fla. and Havana,
Cuba on investigation as to use of electrozone as a germicide in Havana.

div1.closer:
A. S. Dabney,
Lieut. Colonel, Medical Corps,
Executive Officer.
